Hernán Cortés in 1519, from the Codex Azcatitlan. The first members of the Franciscan order reached Mesoamerica about five years later.

notes: For more on the “millenial architecture” built by Franciscans, see Jaime Lara, City, Temple, Stage: Eschatalogical Architecture And Liturgical Theatrics In New Spain, (Notre Dame, 2004).
For further reading about New Spain in the sixteenth century, see the bibliographic guide by Matthew Restall at Oxford Bibliographies.

The true location of the Biblical port of Ophir, where King Solomon was said to have received (to quote English poet John Masefield) “a cargo of ivory and apes and peacocks, sandalwood, cedarwood, and sweet white wine” is a matter of some conjecture. Thomé Lopes, the Portuguese scrivener of Vasco de Gama, speculated that the Biblical Ophir may have corresponded with Great Zimbabwe.

notes.caption: An illustration of Daniel’s famous statue of gold, silver, brass, iron and clay, each material representing the great empires of ancient times, from Clarence Larkin’s The Book of Daniel [(1929)](http://books.google.com/books/about/The_Book_Of_Daniel.html?id=NE7__pHNPUcC).
